content: theo s cowl years ago i made myself this simple cowl to wear on my morning walks it has been absolute workhorse of a knitwear item worn half the year almost daily and washed dozens of times mine is made with lion brand thick and quick i recently made one for my husband theo who had cowl-envy on our morning walks my cowl is knit taller and often gets folded down when i wear it while theo s cowl is shorter and gets worn just slouched theo s cowl pattern comes with instructions to make a quick and simple neck warmer with less than one skein of super bulky yarn like malabrigo rasta or lion brand thick and quick the pattern is written for one size average adult the cowl is knit in the round from the bottom up you can find a variety of merino wool super bulky yarns for this pattern on my website www northroadknits com what you ll need yarn weight super bulky yarn weight 6 approximately 90-106 yds shown in malabrigo rasta and lion brand wool ease thick and quick needles us size 13 9 0mm 16 or 24 inch 41-61cm circular knitting needles notions stitch marker yarn needle scissors details skill level advanced beginner gauge 2x2 /5x5cm = 5 stitches x 7 row in stockinette stitch using us size 13 9 0mm needles as a guideline measurements cowl is about 11-12 28-30cm wide unstretched when flat and 9-10 23- 25cm from botton makes a roughly 22-24 56-61cm loop abbreviations co - cast on p - purl st s - stitch es k - knit pm - place marker yds - yards theo s cowl | north road knits ©2025 | 2 policies this pattern and photos are property of jamie rex and may not be altered shared or sold do not rewrite any part of this design and sell as your own design you re welcome to sell finished products made with this pattern but please credit the design to me north road knits at www northroadknits com thank you contact me via northroadknits@gmail com if you have any questions if you are on instagram please use #theoscowl and tag me @northroadknits so we can see what you make pattern notes i am a loose knitter so please consider sizing up needles if you are a tight knitter cast on co 60 sts using long tail cast on with us size 13 9 0mm circular needles body round 1 k3 p1* repeat from * all the way around repeat round 1 until your cowl measures 9-10 23-25cm tall finishing you can use any bind off technique you prefer but make sure to not knit too tightly here you may find it helpful to try a stretchy bind off technique to complete your project i like to use the k2 through the back loop decrease method - it also makes a beautiful top edge that looks really nice there are dozens of great tutorials on
